title: WarpGrid SDK — Fork Engineering Implementation
description:
Curated, tested distribution of WebAssembly toolchain components that enables WarpGrid (a Wasm-native cluster orchestrator) to run real-world backend services. Pushes WASI workload compatibility from ~25-35% to 60-70% through 6 coordinated engineering domains:

1. Wasmtime host functions (shim layer foundation)
2. wasi-libc patches (socket/filesystem compat)
3. TinyGo WASI overlay (Go workload support)
4. ComponentizeJS extensions (TypeScript/Node.js support)
5. WASI 0.3 async pre-integration (async I/O)
6. Bun WASI runtime (Bun/TypeScript support)

85 user stories across 7 sections with explicit dependency chains.

Quality Gates (per domain):
- Rust: cargo check && cargo test && cargo clippy -- -D warnings
- C/libc: make + scripts/test-libc.sh
- Go: tinygo build -target=wasip2 + go test ./...
- TypeScript: npm run typecheck + npm test
- Bun: bun run typecheck + bun test
- All: TDD (tests written BEFORE implementation)

title: US-101: Scaffold the warpgrid-host crate with dependencies
description:
Milestone: M1.1 | Depends on: none

As a SDK developer, I want a properly structured warpgrid-host crate with all required dependencies so that I have a compilable foundation for implementing host function shims.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] crates/warpgrid-host/ directory exists with Cargo.toml and src/lib.rs
- [ ] Cargo.toml declares dependencies on wasmtime, wasmtime-wasi, tokio (with rt-multi-thread, macros, net, time features), tracing, and anyhow
- [ ] Dev-dependencies include tokio (with test-util), tracing-subscriber, and wasmtime (with component-model feature)
- [ ] src/lib.rs contains public crate-level module structure (empty modules for filesystem, dns, signals, db_proxy, threading, config, engine)
- [ ] cargo check -p warpgrid-host passes with zero errors

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)
close_reason: Scaffolded crate with all modules, workspace integration, and quality gates passing

title: US-110: Signal handling integration tests
description:
Milestone: M1.4 | Depends on: US-109

As a SDK developer, I want integration tests proving Wasm modules can register for and receive signals.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Test: Wasm component registers for terminate, host delivers it, poll-signal returns it
- [ ] Test: poll-signal on empty queue returns None
- [ ] Test: queue bounding — 20 signals delivered, only 16 most recent retrievable
- [ ] Test: signal filtering — register hangup only, deliver terminate, poll returns None
- [ ] All integration tests against real Wasmtime engine instance

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-111: Implement the database connection pool manager
description:
Milestone: M1.5 | Depends on: US-102

As a Wasm workload, I want a host-side connection pool that manages database connections per (host, port, database, user) tuple so that connection reuse is efficient.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] ConnectionPoolManager maintains pool keyed by (host, port, database, user)
- [ ] Pool size configurable per tuple (default: 10)
- [ ] Idle connections reaped after configurable timeout (default: 300s)
- [ ] Health checking pings idle connections on configurable interval (default: 30s)
- [ ] TLS via rustls with configurable certificate verification
- [ ] connect returns opaque u64 connection handle
- [ ] close returns connection to pool (not destroyed unless unhealthy)
- [ ] Pool exhausted: block with timeout (default: 5s) or return error
- [ ] Pool statistics emitted as tracing::info metrics

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-112: Implement Postgres wire protocol passthrough
description:
Milestone: M1.5 | Depends on: US-111

As a Wasm workload, I want to send and receive raw Postgres wire protocol bytes through the database proxy so that existing Postgres client libraries work without modification.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] send host function accepts connection handle and byte buffer, forwards to Postgres TCP connection
- [ ] recv host function reads bytes from Postgres connection (configurable timeout, default: 30s)
- [ ] Host performs no parsing or transformation — pure byte passthrough
- [ ] Host manages TLS transparently: guest sends/receives plaintext, host encrypts/decrypts via rustls
- [ ] Invalid connection handles return clear error
- [ ] database-proxy host functions registered with Wasmtime Linker matching database-proxy.wit

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-113: Database proxy unit tests with mock Postgres server
description:
Milestone: M1.5 | Depends on: US-112

As a SDK developer, I want unit tests using a mock Postgres server to verify connection pooling, health checking, idle timeout, and byte passthrough.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] MockPostgresServer test helper listens on local TCP port and responds to startup handshake
- [ ] Test: connect returns valid handle, close returns to pool, reconnect reuses pooled connection
- [ ] Test: pool exhausted returns timeout error
- [ ] Test: idle connections reaped after configured timeout
- [ ] Test: health check removes connections that fail ping
- [ ] Test: send and recv pass bytes through without modification
- [ ] Test: send/recv on invalid handle returns error

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

- [ ] Executes CREATE TABLE, INSERT, SELECT, DROP TABLE and verifies results
- [ ] Verifies connection reuse (multiple queries on same handle)
- [ ] Verifies close followed by reconnect reuses pooled connection
- [ ] Integration test gated behind cfg(feature = "integration") or #[ignore]

title: US-118: Implement threading model declaration host function
description:
Milestone: M1.7 | Depends on: US-102

As a Wasm workload, I want to declare my threading model to the host so it can configure appropriate execution mode and warn if unsupported.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] declare-threading-model accepts enum (parallel-required, cooperative)
- [ ] If parallel-required: host emits tracing::warn about unsupported parallel threading
- [ ] If cooperative: host enables sequential/cooperative execution mode
- [ ] Threading model stored per instance and queryable
- [ ] Calling declare-threading-model twice returns error (immutable once declared)
- [ ] threading host function registered with Linker matching threading.wit

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Unit test: parallel-required emits warning (verified via tracing subscriber)
- [ ] Unit test: calling twice returns error

title: US-102: Define WIT interfaces and generate Rust bindings
description:
Milestone: M1.1 | Depends on: US-101

As a SDK developer, I want WIT interface definitions for all shim domains with generated Rust bindings so that guest modules have typed contracts for each host function.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] crates/warpgrid-host/wit/ directory contains WIT files: filesystem.wit, dns.wit, signals.wit, database-proxy.wit, threading.wit
- [ ] filesystem.wit declares functions for opening, reading, and stat-ing virtual paths
- [ ] dns.wit declares a resolve-address function accepting a hostname and returning a list of IP address records
- [ ] signals.wit declares on-signal and poll-signal functions with signal-type enum (terminate, hangup, interrupt)
- [ ] database-proxy.wit declares connect, send, recv, and close functions operating on an opaque connection-handle (u64)
- [ ] threading.wit declares declare-threading-model accepting an enum (parallel-required, cooperative)
- [ ] Rust bindings are generated via wasmtime::component::bindgen! macro in a dedicated bindings module
- [ ] cargo check -p warpgrid-host passes after binding generation

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-120: Implement ShimConfig parsing from deployment spec
description:
Milestone: M1.8 | Depends on: US-101

As an operator, I want shim configuration parsed from warp.toml [shims] section so I can enable/disable shims per deployment without recompiling.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] ShimConfig struct with boolean/optional fields for each shim: filesystem, dns, signals, database_proxy, threading
- [ ] Each field supports domain-specific sub-config (e.g., dns.ttl_seconds, database_proxy.pool_size)
- [ ] ShimConfig implements Default with all shims enabled
- [ ] ShimConfig::from_toml(value) parses [shims] table
- [ ] Unknown shim names produce tracing::warn (not error) for forward compat
- [ ] Missing [shims] section results in default config

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-121: Implement WarpGridEngine wrapper API
description:
Milestone: M1.8 | Depends on: US-120, US-104, US-106, US-109, US-112, US-118

As a SDK developer, I want a WarpGridEngine struct that selectively registers only enabled host functions so that instantiation is clean and unused shims incur zero overhead.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] WarpGridEngine wraps wasmtime::Engine and ShimConfig
- [ ] WarpGridEngine::new(config) constructs engine and validates config
- [ ] WarpGridEngine::instantiate(module_bytes) creates store, linker, instance with only enabled shims
- [ ] Disabled filesystem = no filesystem host functions registered
- [ ] Disabled dns = no DNS host functions registered
- [ ] Disabled signals = no signal host functions registered
- [ ] Disabled database_proxy = no proxy host functions registered
- [ ] Disabled threading = no threading host functions registered
- [ ] Startup logging lists enabled/disabled shims and key config values

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-122: ShimConfig and WarpGridEngine integration tests
description:
Milestone: M1.8 | Depends on: US-121

As a SDK developer, I want integration tests proving the engine correctly enables/disables shims based on configuration.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Test: all shims enabled — module calls functions from every shim domain
- [ ] Test: only filesystem enabled — reads /etc/hosts but LinkError on DNS calls
- [ ] Test: only dns enabled — resolves hostnames but LinkError on filesystem calls
- [ ] Test: no shims enabled — only standard WASI functions work
- [ ] Test: TOML config parsing produces expected ShimConfig
- [ ] Test: startup logs correctly list enabled/disabled shims

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-201: Fork wasi-libc and establish patched build pipeline
description:
Milestone: M2.1 | Depends on: none

As a SDK build engineer, I want a reproducible fork of wasi-libc pinned to a known upstream tag with CI that builds both stock and patched variants.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Build script clones wasi-libc at commit hash in libc-patches/UPSTREAM_REF
- [ ] Stock build succeeds with make -j THREAD_MODEL=single producing valid sysroot
- [ ] CI builds both stock and patched wasi-libc; both produce sysroot with libc.a
- [ ] Minimal C program compiles and links against both sysroots
- [ ] libc-patches/UPSTREAM_REF contains pinned commit hash and tag
- [ ] scripts/build-libc.sh accepts --stock and --patched flags

## Quality Gates
- [ ] make builds pass
- [ ] scripts/test-libc.sh passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-202: Create patch maintenance and rebase tooling
description:
Milestone: M2.5 (early) | Depends on: US-201

As a SDK maintainer, I want scripts to apply, export, and rebase patch files against upstream wasi-libc.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] scripts/rebase-libc.sh --apply applies patches from libc-patches/*.patch
- [ ] --apply reports conflicting files and exits non-zero on conflict
- [ ] --export regenerates patch files from warpgrid branch
- [ ] --update fetches new upstream ref and attempts rebase
- [ ] scripts/test-libc.sh compiles test programs, runs in Wasmtime, reports pass/fail
- [ ] Each script includes --help output

## Quality Gates
- [ ] make builds pass
- [ ] scripts/test-libc.sh passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-203: Patch DNS getaddrinfo to route through WarpGrid shim
description:
Milestone: M2.2 | Depends on: US-201, US-202, US-106

As a developer compiling C to WASI, I want getaddrinfo() to route through warpgrid:shim/dns.resolve() before falling back to default.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] C program calling getaddrinfo("db.production.warp.local", "5432", ...) resolves via shim
- [ ] When shim returns empty, getaddrinfo falls through to original WASI impl
- [ ] AI_NUMERICHOST flag bypasses shim entirely
- [ ] Weak symbol import (__attribute__((weak))) for graceful degradation
- [ ] Patch exported as libc-patches/0001-dns-getaddrinfo-shim.patch

## Quality Gates
- [ ] make builds pass
- [ ] scripts/test-libc.sh passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

description:
Milestone: M2.2 | Depends on: US-203

As a developer using legacy DNS APIs in C code compiled to WASI, I want gethostbyname() and getnameinfo() to route through WarpGrid DNS shim.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] gethostbyname("cache.staging.warp.local") returns address from dns.resolve shim
- [ ] getnameinfo() with WarpGrid-managed address returns correct hostname
- [ ] Non-WarpGrid addresses fall through to default behavior
- [ ] Both patches share weak-symbol mechanism from US-203
- [ ] Patches exported as 0002 and 0003 patch files

- [ ] make builds pass

- [ ] Binary size of libc.a within 5% of stock

title: US-206: Patch fopen/open to intercept virtual filesystem paths
description:
Milestone: M2.3 | Depends on: US-201, US-202, US-104

Intercept fopen()/open() for WarpGrid virtual paths and return content from filesystem.read-virtual shim.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] fopen("/etc/resolv.conf", "r") returns content from filesystem.read-virtual shim
- [ ] Returned FILE* supports fread, fgets, fclose, feof correctly
- [ ] open() returns valid fd supporting read() and close() on in-memory buffer
- [ ] Non-virtual paths fall through to original WASI implementation
- [ ] Write mode on virtual path returns NULL with EROFS
- [ ] Weak symbol imports for graceful degradation
- [ ] Patch exported as libc-patches/0004-fs-virtual-open.patch

## Quality Gates
- [ ] make builds pass
- [ ] scripts/test-libc.sh passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-207: Patch timezone loading to use virtual filesystem
description:
Milestone: M2.3 | Depends on: US-206

As a developer whose WASI program calls localtime(), I want timezone data loaded from virtual /usr/share/zoneinfo/ via filesystem shim.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] localtime() with TZ=America/New_York reads virtual zoneinfo, returns correct UTC offset
- [ ] strftime %Z outputs correct timezone abbreviation for Europe/London
- [ ] Unknown timezone falls back to UTC without crashing
- [ ] __tz.c patch reuses virtual file read mechanism from US-206
- [ ] Patch exported as libc-patches/0005-fs-timezone-virtual.patch

## Quality Gates
- [ ] make builds pass
- [ ] scripts/test-libc.sh passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-103: Implement the virtual file map
description:
Milestone: M1.2 | Depends on: US-102

As a Wasm workload, I want reads to well-known system paths (/dev/null, /dev/urandom, /etc/resolv.conf, /etc/hosts, /proc/self/, /usr/share/zoneinfo/**) to return WarpGrid-controlled content so that my application behaves correctly in a sandboxed environment.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] A VirtualFileMap struct holds an immutable map of virtual path prefixes to content-provider functions
- [ ] /dev/null returns empty content on read, accepts and discards all writes
- [ ] /dev/urandom returns cryptographically random bytes via getrandom on each read
- [ ] /etc/resolv.conf returns a configurable nameserver configuration (default: nameserver 127.0.0.1)
- [ ] /etc/hosts returns a configurable hosts mapping (populated from service registry)
- [ ] /proc/self/ paths return synthetic process metadata
- [ ] /usr/share/zoneinfo/** returns embedded timezone data for common timezones (at minimum UTC, US/Eastern, US/Pacific, Europe/London)
- [ ] VirtualFileMap is constructed immutably from a builder, not mutated after creation

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-208: Verify filesystem patches with stock build and edge cases
description:
Milestone: M2.3 | Depends on: US-206, US-207

Comprehensive edge-case coverage for virtual filesystem patches.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Partial reads with small buffers (1 byte, 16 bytes) and lseek work correctly
- [ ] Opening same virtual path twice returns independent fds with independent positions
- [ ] In vanilla Wasmtime (no shims): fopen returns NULL with ENOENT (graceful degradation)
- [ ] Stock wasi-libc builds with filesystem patches present
- [ ] No fd or memory leak across 1000 open/close cycles

## Quality Gates
- [ ] make builds pass
- [ ] scripts/test-libc.sh passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-209: Patch connect() to route database proxy connections
description:
Milestone: M2.4 | Depends on: US-201, US-202, US-112

Patch connect() to detect WarpGrid proxy endpoints and route through database-proxy.connect().

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] connect() to proxy address invokes database-proxy.connect(), returns valid fd
- [ ] connect() to non-proxy address falls through to original WASI socket impl
- [ ] Returned fd tracked internally as proxied for subsequent send/recv routing
- [ ] Weak symbol fallback when proxy shim absent
- [ ] Proxy endpoint detection configurable via /etc/warpgrid/proxy.conf (via filesystem shim)
- [ ] Patch exported as libc-patches/0006-socket-connect-proxy.patch

## Quality Gates
- [ ] make builds pass
- [ ] scripts/test-libc.sh passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-210: Patch send/recv/read/write for proxied file descriptors
description:
Milestone: M2.4 | Depends on: US-209

Route send/recv/read/write on proxied fds through database-proxy shim.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] send(fd, data, len, 0) delivers via database-proxy.send()
- [ ] recv(fd, buf, len, 0) reads from database-proxy.recv()
- [ ] read/write on proxied fds also route through proxy (libpq uses read/write)
- [ ] Non-proxied fds behave identically to unpatched wasi-libc
- [ ] Partial reads handled correctly without data loss
- [ ] MSG_PEEK returns data without consuming
- [ ] Patch exported as libc-patches/0007-socket-send-recv-proxy.patch

## Quality Gates
- [ ] make builds pass
- [ ] scripts/test-libc.sh passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-211: Patch close() for proxied fds
description:
Milestone: M2.4 | Depends on: US-210

close() on proxied fd calls database-proxy.close() and cleans up tracking state.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] close(fd) on proxied fd invokes database-proxy.close(), removes from tracking
- [ ] After close, read/write/send/recv return -1 with EBADF
- [ ] Non-proxied fd close behaves identically to unpatched
- [ ] 100 connect/send/recv/close cycles without fd leaks
- [ ] Patch exported as libc-patches/0008-socket-close-proxy.patch

## Quality Gates
- [ ] make builds pass
- [ ] scripts/test-libc.sh passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)
close_reason: US-211 complete: close() patched for proxied fds. 10/10 tests pass, 0 regressions across all 41 tests (DNS 4/4, FS 10/10, Connect 7/7, SendRecv 10/10, Close 10/10). Patch exported as 0005-socket-close-proxy.patch.

title: US-212: End-to-end database driver compilation and connection test
description:
Milestone: M2.4 | Depends on: US-211, US-203

Compile libpq and Go pgx against patched wasi-libc and connect to Postgres through proxy.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] libpq compiles against patched sysroot without (or minimal) modifications
- [ ] C program using libpq executes PQconnectdb, SELECT 1, disconnects through proxy
- [ ] Go program with TinyGo using database/sql + pgx connects, executes SELECT version(), disconnects
- [ ] Connection errors propagate as standard error codes, not crashes
- [ ] DNS resolution for db hostname uses DNS shim

## Quality Gates
- [ ] make builds pass
- [ ] scripts/test-libc.sh passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)
notes:
## Completion Status (2026-02-23)

### DONE
- [x] libpq cross-compiled to wasm32-wasip2: 39/39 source files, 0 failures
- [x] C raw wire protocol test: 8/8 tests pass (test_e2e_postgres.c)
- [x] C libpq-based test: 6/6 tests pass (test_libpq_e2e.c)
  - PQconnectdb through proxy: PASS
  - PQexec SELECT 1 returns '1': PASS
  - PQfinish triggers proxy close: PASS
  - Connection error → CONNECTION_BAD (not crash): PASS
  - All proxy shim layers invoked: PASS
  - Server version parsed from ParameterStatus: PASS
- [x] Connection errors propagate as standard error codes
- [x] DNS resolution uses DNS shim (verified in raw wire test)

### BLOCKED — Go/TinyGo test
Go program with TinyGo + pgx is blocked on Domain 3 (US-303..US-305):
- US-303: Patch net.Dial for TCP via wasi-sockets
- US-304: Patch net.Dial DNS resolution via WarpGrid shim
- US-305: Validate pgx Postgres driver over patched net.Dial
These must be implemented first before Go database drivers can work.

### Artifacts
- scripts/build-libpq.sh — Cross-compilation script (downloads PG 16.2, builds 39 source files)
- build/libpq-wasm/ — Static library + headers for wasm32-wasip2
- libc-patches/tests/test_e2e_postgres.c — Raw wire protocol e2e test
- libc-patches/tests/test_libpq_e2e.c — libpq API e2e test

title: US-301: Fork TinyGo and establish reproducible build pipeline
description:
Milestone: M3.1 | Depends on: none

Fork TinyGo with automated build-from-source pipeline.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] TinyGo cloned at latest release tag (>= 0.34.x) into vendor/tinygo/
- [ ] scripts/build-tinygo.sh builds from source using Go 1.22+ and LLVM

- [ ] go test ./... passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-104: Implement filesystem intercept logic as host functions
description:
Milestone: M1.2 | Depends on: US-103

As a Wasm workload, I want filesystem operations to be intercepted so that virtual paths return WarpGrid content while all other paths fall through to the real WASI filesystem implementation.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Filesystem host functions are registered with the Wasmtime Linker matching the filesystem.wit interface
- [ ] On any file-open or file-read call, the path is checked against the VirtualFileMap before delegating to wasmtime-wasi
- [ ] If the path matches a virtual entry, the virtual content provider is invoked and results returned directly
- [ ] If the path does not match, the call is forwarded to the underlying WASI filesystem implementation unchanged
- [ ] Path matching handles both exact paths and prefix matches (e.g., /usr/share/zoneinfo/ prefix)
- [ ] Path canonicalization prevents bypass via .. or symlink traversal
- [ ] All intercept decisions are logged at tracing::debug level

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-304: Patch net.Dial DNS resolution via WarpGrid shim

net.Dial resolves hostnames through WarpGrid DNS shim.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Patched net.Dial calls warpgrid:dns/resolve when host is not IP literal
- [ ] net.Dial("tcp", "postgres:5432") resolves and connects
- [ ] DNS failure wrapped as *net.OpError
- [ ] Multiple A records tried in order (failover)

title: US-106: Implement core DNS resolution chain
description:
Milestone: M1.3 | Depends on: US-102

As a Wasm workload, I want hostname resolution to check the WarpGrid service registry first, then /etc/hosts, then host system DNS so that intra-cluster services resolve correctly while external domains still work.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] A DnsResolver struct is constructed with an injected HashMap<String, Vec<IpAddr>> representing the service registry
- [ ] Resolution chain: (1) service registry lookup, (2) virtual /etc/hosts lookup, (3) fallback to host system DNS via tokio::net::lookup_host
- [ ] Resolution stops at the first chain link that returns results
- [ ] The resolve-address host function is registered with the Wasmtime Linker matching the dns.wit interface
- [ ] If no chain link resolves, a clear HostNotFound error is returned to the guest
- [ ] All resolution steps are logged at tracing::debug level

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-107: DNS caching with TTL and round-robin selection
description:
Milestone: M1.3 | Depends on: US-106

As a Wasm workload, I want DNS results cached with configurable TTL and addresses returned in round-robin order so that resolution is fast and load is distributed across service replicas.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] TTL-based cache stores resolved addresses keyed by hostname (default: 30 seconds)
- [ ] Cache entries evicted after TTL expires; subsequent lookups re-resolve
- [ ] Multiple addresses returned in round-robin order across consecutive calls
- [ ] Round-robin uses atomic counter per-hostname (no mutex contention)
- [ ] Cache bounded in size (default: 1024 entries) with LRU eviction
- [ ] Cache statistics (hits, misses, evictions) exposed as tracing::info metrics

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-607: Implement @warpgrid/bun-sdk/dns
description:
Milestone: M6.3 | Depends on: US-106, US-601
Dual-mode DNS resolution for Bun handlers.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] resolve(hostname, rrtype?) returns Promise<string[]> for A, AAAA, CNAME
- [ ] Dev mode: Bun native DNS
- [ ] Wasm mode: Domain 1 DNS shim
- [ ] Non-existent domain throws WarpGridDnsError ENOTFOUND
- [ ] Timeout parameter supported with ETIMEOUT
## Quality Gates
- [ ] bun run typecheck passes, bun test passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-608: Implement @warpgrid/bun-sdk/fs
description:
Milestone: M6.3 | Depends on: US-104, US-601
Dual-mode filesystem for Bun handlers.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] readFile, readTextFile, writeFile, exists exported
- [ ] Dev mode: Bun native fs
- [ ] Wasm mode: Domain 1 filesystem shim
- [ ] Path traversal throws WarpGridFsPermissionError
- [ ] Non-existent path throws WarpGridFsNotFoundError
## Quality Gates
- [ ] bun run typecheck passes, bun test passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-609: E2e Bun handler queries Postgres in native and Wasm modes
description:
Milestone: M6.3 | Depends on: US-605, US-606
Dual-mode parity test for database access.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Test fixture: POST /users (insert, 201) and GET /users/:id (query, 200/404)
- [ ] Native Bun mode: create user, fetch by ID, assert responses
- [ ] Wasm mode: same assertions after warp pack --lang bun
- [ ] Response bodies byte-identical between modes
## Quality Gates
- [ ] bun run typecheck passes, bun test passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-610: Implement warp dev --lang bun with watch and hot-reload
description:
Milestone: M6.4 | Depends on: US-603, US-605
Local dev with Wasmtime, file watching, hot-reload under 2 seconds.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] warp dev --lang bun starts HTTP server backed by Wasmtime
- [ ] File watcher detects .ts/.tsx/.js/.jsx changes, recompiles, swaps module
- [ ] Change v1->v2, assert new response within 2 seconds
- [ ] --native mode runs directly in Bun
- [ ] Compilation errors shown without crashing; previous module continues serving
## Quality Gates
- [ ] bun run typecheck passes, bun test passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-611: Implement bun run --warpgrid native dev mode
description:
Milestone: M6.4 | Depends on: US-606, US-607, US-608
Bun preload script registers WarpGrid shims for native dev.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] @warpgrid/bun-sdk/preload.ts registers shims via bun run --preload
- [ ] Convenience alias via bunfig.toml preload configuration
- [ ] Test: handler responds correctly with database shim (mock)
- [ ] WARPGRID_MODE=development env var set
## Quality Gates
- [ ] bun run typecheck passes, bun test passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-612: Test top 20 Bun packages for Wasm compatibility
description:
Milestone: M6.5 | Depends on: US-603, US-604
Automated compat testing of 20 Bun packages.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] compat-db/bun/packages.json lists 20 packages with pinned versions
- [ ] Each tested: import in handler, warp pack --lang bun, record pass/fail
- [ ] CI nightly job opens issue on regression
- [ ] Native binding failures documented with alternatives
## Quality Gates
- [ ] bun run typecheck passes, bun test passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-108: DNS shim integration tests
description:
Milestone: M1.3 | Depends on: US-107

As a SDK developer, I want integration tests proving the DNS resolution chain works end-to-end inside a Wasm component.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Test: Wasm component resolves a service name in the injected registry
- [ ] Test: Wasm component resolves a hostname in virtual /etc/hosts
- [ ] Test: Wasm component resolves external hostname via host system DNS
- [ ] Test: round-robin behavior verified across multiple calls
- [ ] Test: TTL caching verified — cached value within TTL, new value after expiry
- [ ] All integration tests run against a real Wasmtime engine instance

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-613: Integrate Bun compat data into warp-analyzer
description:
Milestone: M6.5 | Depends on: US-612
warp analyze --lang bun scans package.json for Wasm compat.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Reads package.json and bun.lockb, cross-references compat-db/bun/results.json
- [ ] Prints table: package, version, status, notes
- [ ] Incompatible deps exit code 1 with summary
- [ ] --json flag for machine-readable output
## Quality Gates
- [ ] bun run typecheck passes, bun test passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-614: Register --lang bun as first-class warp pack target
description:
Milestone: M6.6 | Depends on: US-603, US-610
--lang bun is peer of rust, go, typescript in warp pack CLI.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] warp pack --help lists bun alongside other languages
- [ ] Auto-detects Bun from bunfig.toml
- [ ] docs/guides/bun-vs-typescript.md explains differences
- [ ] scripts/test-bun.sh runs full Bun test suite in CI
- [ ] compat-db/bun/ in repo tree and README
## Quality Gates
- [ ] bun run typecheck passes, bun test passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-615: Create warp init --template bun project scaffolding
description:
Milestone: M6.6 | Depends on: US-601, US-602, US-614
Ready-to-run WarpGrid Bun project scaffolding.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] warp init --template bun creates package.json, bunfig.toml, tsconfig.json, src/index.ts, src/index.test.ts
- [ ] bun install && bun test passes in generated project
- [ ] warp pack --lang bun produces valid .wasm
- [ ] src/index.ts includes commented examples for database, DNS, fs
- [ ] .warpgrid.toml with lang = "bun" for auto-detection
## Quality Gates
- [ ] bun run typecheck passes, bun test passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-701: Docker Compose test dependency stack
description:
Milestone: Integration | Depends on: none
Docker Compose with Postgres, Redis, mock service registry.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] test-infra/docker-compose.yml: postgres (16), redis (7), mock-registry
- [ ] test-infra/seed.sql: test_users (5 rows), test_analytics table
- [ ] test-infra/wait-for-deps.sh polls services, exits 0 when ready or 1 after 60s
- [ ] Integration test: bring up, wait, SELECT 1 + PING, tear down
- [ ] tmpfs for clean state every run
## Quality Gates
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-702: Rust HTTP + Postgres integration test (T1)
description:
Milestone: Integration | Depends on: US-701, US-122, US-112, US-106
E2e Rust axum handler with DNS and database proxy shims.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] test-apps/t1-rust-http-postgres/ with axum app
- [ ] Compiles to wasm32-wasip2 with patched sysroot
- [ ] GET /users returns 200 with 5 seed users
- [ ] POST /users returns 201; GET reflects new user
- [ ] DNS shim resolve call for db.test.warp.local verified
- [ ] DB proxy unreachable returns 503
## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check, cargo test pass
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-703: Rust HTTP + Redis + Postgres integration test (T2)
description:
Milestone: Integration | Depends on: US-702, US-116
Redis caching layer with two proxied connections in one module.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] test-apps/t2-rust-http-redis-postgres/ with cache-aside pattern
- [ ] Cold cache: Postgres queried, Redis SET called
- [ ] Warm cache: Redis GET returns cached, Postgres NOT queried
- [ ] TTL expiry: Postgres re-queried after flush
- [ ] Pool metrics: exactly 1 Postgres + 1 Redis connection
## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check, cargo test pass
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-704: Go HTTP + Postgres integration test (T3)
description:
Milestone: Integration | Depends on: US-701, US-311, US-307
Go net/http handler with patched TinyGo and database proxy.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] test-apps/t3-go-http-postgres/ with net/http + pgx
- [ ] Compiles with warp-tinygo to wasip2
- [ ] GET /users returns 200 with seed users
- [ ] POST /users returns 201; GET reflects new user
- [ ] net.Dial routed through database proxy
- [ ] Invalid db host returns 503
## Quality Gates
- [ ] tinygo build, go test pass
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-705: TypeScript HTTP + Postgres integration test (T4)
description:
Milestone: Integration | Depends on: US-701, US-405, US-410
TypeScript hono handler via ComponentizeJS with Postgres.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] test-apps/t4-ts-http-postgres/ with hono + warpgrid/pg
- [ ] Compiles via warp pack --lang js
- [ ] GET /users returns 200 with seed users
- [ ] POST /users returns 201; GET reflects new row
- [ ] warpgrid.database.connect() invoked (not raw TCP)
- [ ] process.env.APP_NAME accessible in response headers
## Quality Gates
- [ ] npm run typecheck, npm test pass
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-706: Bun HTTP + Postgres integration test (T5)
description:
Milestone: Integration | Depends on: US-701, US-609, US-614
Bun handler via warp pack --lang bun with behavioral parity to T4.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] test-apps/t5-bun-http-postgres/ with hono + @warpgrid/bun-sdk/postgres
- [ ] Compiles via warp pack --lang bun
- [ ] GET /users returns 200 with seed users
- [ ] POST /users returns 201
- [ ] Response body byte-identical to T4 for same request
- [ ] Bun polyfills work (Bun.env, Bun.sleep)
## Quality Gates
- [ ] bun run typecheck, bun test pass
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-707: Multi-service polyglot integration test (T6)
description:
Milestone: Integration | Depends on: US-702, US-704, US-705, US-706
4 Wasm modules (Rust gateway, Go user svc, TS notification svc, Bun analytics svc) in one engine.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] test-apps/t6-multi-service/ with 4 sub-applications
- [ ] Each compiles to separate Wasm component
- [ ] DNS routes *.test.warp.local to correct endpoints
- [ ] Full flow: POST /users->201, POST /notify->202 (Redis), POST /analytics/event->201 (Postgres), GET /users->new user
- [ ] test_analytics has event row, Redis list consumed notification
- [ ] Service error includes X-WarpGrid-Source-Service header
## Quality Gates
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-109: Implement signal queue and host functions
description:
Milestone: M1.4 | Depends on: US-102

As a Wasm workload, I want to register interest in lifecycle signals and poll a bounded signal queue so that I can perform graceful shutdown or reconfiguration.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] SignalQueue struct provides bounded queue (capacity: 16) of signal types (terminate, hangup, interrupt)
- [ ] on-signal host function registers interest in signal types for calling module instance
- [ ] poll-signal host function dequeues oldest signal or returns None if empty
- [ ] If queue full, oldest signal dropped with tracing::warn
- [ ] Host-side deliver_signal(instance_id, signal_type) enqueues signal
- [ ] Only signals matching registered interest are enqueued
- [ ] signals host functions registered with Wasmtime Linker matching signals.wit

## Quality Gates
- [ ] cargo check passes
- [ ] cargo test passes
- [ ] cargo clippy -- -D warnings passes
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-708: test-all.sh orchestration script
description:
Milestone: Integration | Depends on: US-701-US-707
Single script for full integration test lifecycle.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] scripts/test-all.sh: validate prereqs, docker-compose up, wait, build T1-T6, run tests, summary, teardown
- [ ] --only t1,t3 for subset, --keep-deps, --verbose flags
- [ ] Logs to test-results/ with timestamps
- [ ] Build failure skips dependent tests (SKIP status)
- [ ] --dry-run prints execution plan
## Quality Gates
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-709: CI pipeline integration for cross-domain tests
description:
Milestone: Integration | Depends on: US-708
GitHub Actions workflow for automated integration tests.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] .github/workflows/integration-tests.yml triggers on PRs and pushes to main
- [ ] Matrix strategy: each test app (T1-T6) as separate job + summary job
- [ ] Jobs: checkout, setup toolchains (cached), docker services, build, test, upload artifacts
- [ ] 15-minute timeout, build caching via actions/cache
- [ ] Nightly schedule on main for flaky regression detection
## Quality Gates
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)

title: US-710: Cross-domain performance baseline
description:
Milestone: Integration | Depends on: US-708
Latency and throughput metrics baseline for regression detection.
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Per-request metrics: total latency, DNS time, DB proxy time, response size
- [ ] test-infra/bench-harness/ sends 100 sequential + 100 concurrent requests per app
- [ ] Results to test-results/performance-baseline.json with p50/p95/p99
- [ ] Quality gate: shim overhead < 10% vs direct connection
- [ ] scripts/compare-perf.sh diffs against main baseline
- [ ] >20% p95 regression exits with warning
## Quality Gates
- [ ] Tests written before implementation (TDD)
